3 f. verecundum . . . Bacchum: the god who requires moderatiori in his devotees; modicus Liber 1, 18, 7. Hence the drunken shouting (impium clamorem, v. 6) is an offense against him. —prohibete: save from.

5 f. Medus acinaces: the short sword of the Mede83 probably taken from the Greek original. The wearing of the sword at a banquet or drinking bout was a distinctly barbarian custom to the Roman, who was forbidden by law to carry weapons within the city
